title: Urine in trouble: Public servant is sacked after peeing in a WORK KETTLE
text:
A public servant has been sacked after bosses found traces of urine in the office kettle.

The employee for Disability SA, in South Australia, was dismissed in July after a year-long investigation, the Department of Human Services confirmed on Tuesday.

Two casual staff reported the incident after smelling a strong and unusual odour from the kettle in March 2018.

Workers were concerned that there might have been blood present in the urine, but no blood was found.

A public servant has been fired after urine was found in the office's kitchen kettle (stock image)

A spokeswoman from the Department of Human Services told Daily Mail Australia an investigation commenced following the report.

'The investigation found that urine was present in a workplace kettle. No blood was found,' the spokeswoman said.

'The thorough investigation found that a particular individual was at fault and this employee has since been terminated from the department.'

Documents obtained by InDaily said an on-duty nurse in the building tested the liquid and confirmed it was urine.

A complaint was lodged to authorities, which had been signed by several staff, who complained over the 'complete lack of transparency over the last twelve months'.

Two casual staff at the Disability SA after hours office (pictured) reported the incident after smelling a strong and unusual odour from the kettle in March 2018

Staff claimed they were left in the dark about the progress of the investigation.

'It seems that the confidentiality of the [alleged] perpetrator has been of more importance than the health, welfare and emotional/mental wellbeing of valuable staff,' the document read.

The document says employees are showing symptoms of what appear to be post-traumatic stress disorder and and sought counselling after the incident.

The spokeswoman said the department takes any allegation of misconduct very seriously.

authors: Paula Ahillon For Daily Mail Australia
